Reviews.Title: “Great motel off the beaten path!”
Reviews.Author: woodyball6
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights on 12/30 & 12/31. Room was clean, bed comfortable and area quiet. Some stated airplane noise since it is close to airport but I only heard one plane the whole time and it was early evening. Parking lot is gated with room key access which we liked. Area was quiet and we will definitely stay there again when in Memphis. Easy access to interstate and great little restaurant right down the road, The Kettle which I will review under the restaurants. Did not eat the motel free breakfast, as we slept in each morning. The only drawback was parking. When we ret'd to our room New Year's Morning about 1:00 am, all the parking in the back was full. Even though our room was in the back, we had to park out front and walk around the building. I am not sure if they have parking spots for every room they rent. Did not appear so during our stay. We had a smoking room and it smelled so fresh, I was pleasantly surprised. Most smoking rooms smell terrible, even for a smoker, but this one did not!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: OldDocI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It was clean, secure, and close enough to where we needed to be. The staff was friendly and helpful. We will chose this hotel again if we return to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Great place near the airport, Graceland. Good, friendly service, too.”
Reviews.Author: okazon69
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is located in an industrial area near the airport, it is quite a nice place to spend a night or two. A quick call on the courtesy phone at the airport brought the shuttle within 10 minutes. A quick drive back to the hotel, and we were able to check in and get to our rooms. At check-in, there was no recognition of the guest's elite status in the BW rewards program, no offer of a room upgrade, no gift bag, no bonus points. A bit unfortunate. The room was large and comfortably arranged. A small sitting area, work desk, very comfortable king bed, enclosed bath/toilet, sink, and a closet. Flat screen TV. Ample lighting. The room looked like it had been recently renovated. Everything was clean and tidy. The shower head is definitely not a water saver model - gallons and gallons of hot water were available at high pressure. Towels were adequate, but could have been a bit larger. The internet connection worked well, albeit slowly. There is a jack for an Ethernet connection, but no cable provided, so I couldn't check if it worked. Breakfast had decent choices, including waffles, yogurt, biscuits, grits, cereal, fresh fruit, various breads, juices, coffee. Overall, very good. On departure, we were offered a shuttle ride to a place nearby, off-airport, without any problems; this was convenient and appreciated. I'd certainly recommend this hotel for a future stay in Memphis near the airport, or for a visit to Graceland.

Reviews.Title: “best western executive inn memphis”
Reviews.Author: debbyt1051
Reviews.Content: Just okay. We stayed 2 nights on a getaway weekend with another couple. If you want the breakfast get there early as they put it away before the posted end time and don't replenish as items are used up. Not a great area but they have gates. If you can lower your expectations this place is adquate but we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B/W but Desolate Area”
Reviews.Author: twolarrys
Reviews.Content: I always opt for B/W motels when price/location are favorable. Chose to stay here for two nights as a tourist visiting Graceland. The Good: Nice large standard room with 'fridge; clean and inviting; good comp breakfast in the morning; friendly staff; good security; quiet neighborhood; easy Interstate I-240 on/off access; an easy short drive to Graceland. The Not-So Good: It's in the middle of no-where. Behind the property is a heavy equip. storage depot and across the street a heavy-duty truck dealership (see photos). There is nothing within walking distance for eating or shopping. The drive to Graceland is through a neighborhood of pawn shops, gas station mini-marts and boarded-up buildings. The tour of Graceland is a surprisingly delightful experience. Unfortunately its location is awful. Elvis Presley Blvd has nothing but fast-food drive-thru's; no sit-down-and-be-served restaurants such as an Applebee's, Chili's, Denny's or Outback. If you are visiting Graceland (a MUST SEE) with family I would suggest staying either in downtown Memphis or outside of town.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Badger541
Reviews.Content: Typical Best Western,clean,good value,located near airport which was perfect for us as we were moving on,no resturants nearby,but a phone call will bring a pink limo to take you to Marlowes for the price of a tip for the driver. This is a great resturant and the hotel will give you a slip for a 10 % discount.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: mdtravelling
Reviews.Content: We were off to a bad start when our key card would not work i the door. on the third try at reprogramming the key the manager finally came to the room and reprogrammed the lock. The security gates and fencing did not create a good first impression either. our room we clean and everything worked. The bed was comfortable but sleep was hard to come by because we were on the street side of the building, a very rough street with lots of truck traffic. If you are oing to stay at this hotel make sure you ask for a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better area !!!”
Reviews.Author: NorthernOhio
Reviews.Content: The location was great in respect to access to Graceland, driving to the mansion was extremely easy but â€¦ ITâ€™S IN THE HOOD ! Half the homes and businesses in the area are boarded up with weeds growing in the yards and parking lots. We were scared to stop anywhere in the area to eat. Graceland itself was very well kept and safe during to daytime in my opinion. The hotel was way over priced for what we got and where it was located (the Hood). Other issues include the wireless network connection didnâ€™t work in our room, the alarm clock was broken, and itâ€™s a very mediocre room at best, very old carpet, musty/mildew smell, etc. I wouldn't stay here, drive to Graceland and park there for the day then leave!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ELMG
Reviews.Content: While the breakfast was so-so the location and room made Memphis a pleasant stay, especially during Elvis Week which is probably their busiest time. Cleanliness in a hotel is paramount to me and the Best Western didn't disappoint. Give it a go if you want a longer term stay like we did - six days worth.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Tiara_1974-10-10
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. The room was very spacious & clean. Location was great, less than 10 minutes to Graceland, just over 10 minutes to Beale St/Downtown. My suggestion when you're booking is to request an inside room. Ours was on the street side & it was quite noisy all night with street traffic & being so close to the highway. I just popped in a pair of earplugs & slept fine but just a suggestion...

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelingOn
Reviews.Content: We drove from Birmingham AL for our anniversary to see Graceland and Beal St. For the price I expected an older somewhat worn-out hotel. It's NOT! We arrived very late to a well lit parking lot and friendly staff. The staff was very nice to deal with both before we got there and during our stay. The room was basic, clean, much larger than I expected, the bed comfortable, and the TV had 3-4 different HBO channels. I was surprised to find four different WiFi channels available in my room -- and free. The AC worked very well and kept the room cool even during the 95+ degree heat. The breakfast area was small but the hours long enough and turn over fast enough that we had a place to sit both days. The food was good and fresh. Our room was closest to the street but there was little road or airport noise. Graceland was 2 miles away and downtown about 15-20 minutes away via the interstate. For the price I suspect this is one of the best bargains in Memphis -- and as nice as rooms costing twice their internet price. I'm glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: flowermom29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Executive Inn the night of June 18, 2009 and were expecting the typical close-to-the-airport type hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised by how clean the room was and how friendly and helpful everyone was there. From check in to check out, we had a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok overnight stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: dunera
Reviews.Content: 2 storey motel, car up to room on 1st floor, unattractive area but close to airport. Rooms are ok standard BW. small pool. wireless internet fine and small business centre. also small gym. Reception not inspiring. Ok continental breakfast. No decent restaurants within 3 miles. Gracelands close by. A good value stay if flying out early am.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Was Better Last Time...”
Reviews.Author: CallyEP
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel one time before and it was wonderful. My first time I picked this hotel because of it's close location to Graceland and it's lower price then most hotels. My first stay they were out of rooms with double beds and gave me a suite for the price of a regular room. The first weekend of March I stayed at this hotel and it wasn't the same. I found blood stains on the sheets. There were food crums on the floor on the side of the desk. In the bathroom the toliet paper was only a half roll and I didn't want to use it. So I got the other roll and took the paper off and there was dried poop smeared all over the new toliet paper, so someone must have wrapped it back up. I called the front desk and all the woman could say was "Sorry" and gave me another roll. You might want to Bring Your Own Toliet Paper!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: dewny37
Reviews.Content: In Memphis to visit downtown and Graceland. This place was convenient to both. The area wasn't too hopping, but it only took 5 - 10 minutes on the highway to get to Beale St, and the same to get to Graceland. Check in was smooth. The room was large, but it was a little dirty. The shower wall was dingy, and the sheets were yellowed but clean. We are very low fuss, so it didn't bother us at all. Great to have a fridge and microwave. I didn't hear any noice from the airport, but there was a bird outside that woke us in the morning. It's not a primo spot, but it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “A New Home For Elvis Week”
Reviews.Author: Katea9tails
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice during my several year visits to Elvis Week. This is my favorite place of all of them and I will return until I am disappointed. Yes it is near the Airport and I am sure there are some fly overs but we are usually so tired that we don't notice - it has never bothered us. Some complaints you have to look for I guess. The neighborhood may not be all bright and secure looking but we have never felt threatened here. The employees reminded us not to leave valuables in sight in our car - well no matter where you are that should be a rule. There seems to be families working there and all were friendly. They were always able to offer suggestions or keep us posted on news we needed. We just left the do not disturb sign up cause we were content with just fresh towels and tissue as needed. They were always happy to swap out towels for us when we saw them on our floor. We often saw someone walking around the building or lot doing their own security. The room is large. We had two queen beds, and a sofa area. Three or Four ladies and all their needs, bling and snacks for 3-4 days and we have never felt cramped. A couple of our folks smoked and the hotel was quick to supply a stand up ashtray outside the door for them. To be able to make this trip we need to make it an affordable trip and this hotel helps. The room price is nice and you get a good breakfast each morning. The pool is nice but we didn't get a chance to use it because they lock it up at 9 PM so as not to disturb those near by who might go to sleep early. I will definitely look for rooms here each year. It is close enough to the Graceland area that we can be there in minutes and if one of us needs to come back for a break - it is a quick round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs and you'll be just fine”
Reviews.Author: tokoloshgrrl
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was pretty decent for the price. Stay here if you're looking for a cheap but reasonable stay. The main problem is the noise. Fedex is based in Memphis, and I think the road the hotel is on carries a lot of their freight traffic. And the nearby airport doesn't help either. Request a room in the back; my friends stayed on the other side and they said it was quieter. Besides the noise, though, we had a fine stay. The room seemed very clean and came with a microwave and large fridge. Also a couch and table. The water pressure in the shower was very nice. One of my traveling companions said it was the best shower he'd had in years. Breakfast is above average -- hardboiled eggs (unpeeled!), bread, bagels, cream cheese, apples, bananas, sausage biscuits, hashbrowns (tasted a little freezer-y), pastries. I didn't use the fitness center but it looked very nice -- bike, treadmill, elliptical, and a few free weights. Staff was very friendly, particularly the guy setting out the breakfast. He also seemed very hygiene conscious which I really appreciated. My only real complaint was there were very few vending options on site. I wanted a bottle of water, but the lone drink machine was empty. There was one rather lame snack machine, too. However, there is a huge Exxon gas station/market about a block away that's open 24 hours a day during the week (closes at 10 Fri/Sat), so I should have just gone down there. Other than the palatial Exxon and the endless parade of trucks passing by, the neighborhood seemed pretty desolate. Not unsafe, just dull.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, barely competent staff”
Reviews.Author: jbrunnerSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to a flight cancellation (NW Airlines - avoid it at all costs). It takes the desk clerk forever to check me in because the place is old and creaky and lacks any technology whatsoever. (Manual credit card machines... still?) When I got into my room, it was dirty. Bed unmade, partly empty food containers on the counters, heater unit looked like it had been kicked apart. They sent me to another room - which also took forever. That room was fine, thought the TV didn't get much reception. The only saving grace of this place is it is VERY close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan58
Reviews.Content: We missed our air connection in Memphis and couldn't get out until the next day. The airline offered us a night at this hotel at a "discount" which turned out not to be much of a discount at all. They arranged everything, however, and when we called for the motel shuttle it arrived promptly. We were, of course, stunned and cranky about airport delay but the motel was fine for our purpose. This is obviously a family owned motel and they were pleasant and helpful. Since our baggage had gone on without us, the desk clerk gave us toothbrushes and toothpaste. We returned to the front desk later looking for bottled water when we found the vending machine out of it. They apologized and handed us a bottle of water. The neighborhood is seedy but the room was clean and very spacious. The free Internet allowed us to get some work done and kept the day from being a complete loss. It's never any fun to miss plane connections, but if I were, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RitaNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be large and airy.Very clean.The staff were helpful.It was a real pleasant experience.would book there again if we do another Elvis week. Alan and Rita.Norfolk.Engand.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: jetsaver
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews we were a bit worried at what we would find. On arrival we checked our room, bedding etc for any problems but found none. The room was very big, comfortable and ideal for airport and downtown. We paid less than Â£30.00 per night, for both of us, with breakfast. Could not get that anywhere in England, especially the size of the room. It was at least 3 times the size of any we have stayed in the U.K. Reception staff were quiet and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: asahel
Reviews.Content: I arranged this stay because of an overnight delay in my return trip from England. I had great expectations, becase I had never had a bad experience in a Best Western. There's a first time for everything. My room turned out to be a smoking room, despite my request for non-smoking. The room was unclean. In the morning when I went to the desk to ask for the complimentary shuttle back to the airport, I was told that "You didn't ask for it the night before." I had to take a taxi. I was very disappointed in this hotel, and won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: LyndhurstTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family found one bed with piss on the bed sheets down to mattress. Our socks were very dirty after walking on carpet. The room was general very dirty. Management did not seem care about our concerns. I asked for refund, and management gave me hard time. They only wanted to give me a "discount". Ridiculous. I finally got refund a month and a half later after several emails with Best Western corporate back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Motel”
Reviews.Author: betsyboop23
Reviews.Content: I was with a party of 8 and we were all apprehensive about staying in a motel but we arrived in Memphis at 6am Saturday morning and we were desparate to find any place to check-in. Since there was a horse show in town, rooms were few and far between. A friend of ours made reservations at another motel, but when we pulled up it looked unsafe, and since the curtains were pulled back we could see that the rooms were small also. The manager tried to get us to pay 1/2 price for Friday since check in wasn't until 2pm. We decided to go elsewhere. That's when we found the Best Western. That manager was understanding and said we could check in with no extra charges. The neighborhood didn't look threatening. And it was minutes from the highway and Graceland. The room was much larger and nicer than I expected. It didn't even seem like a "motel room" it was more like a hotel room. The shower had a massaging shower head and great water pressure. The linens looked and smelled clean. It was a pleasant surprise, considering the room even costed less than the last dump.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dump”
Reviews.Author: gunnercade
Reviews.Content: I also booked this hotel based on previous reviews. Either the reviewers have different standards, or management went downhill since. The room was filthy. Hair on the sheets and the sink. Mold in the bathroom. The pull out bed was so filthy (crumbs, peanuts, pieces of tortilla chips...) that we gave up on it, also because the mattress was thinner than the pillows. How is someone supposed to sleep on that mattress? Beats me. We ended up using an air mattress we had in the car. Service was below average. The young woman who checked me was not even listening to my questions, the man who checked me out seemed not to know what he was doing. Only one woman seemed to have a notion of "customer service," and was prompt and helpful when our room key stopped working. The water pressure was adequate, but the shower curtain is wafer thin and it's easy to flood the bathroom floor. The bathroom door did not lock. Last but not least, the boors above. A family with kids whose parents apparently did not believe in controlling the little lovelies, who as a result screamed and stomped most of the night. I cannot blame the hotel for the rudeness of certain American families, but be forewarned that this is the crowd that hangs out at Best Western. Needless to say, we will NOT be back.

Reviews.Title: “Most have got the wrong room!”
Reviews.Author: jtown41051
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for an overnight stay based soley on the advise of Tripadvisor. This was a typical, by the roadside hotel. Close to the freeway and downtown, red neck to check you in, pool the size of a big hot tub. All that was expected. What makes me rank this hotel so low is the following: Cleanleness: Not what I would call a clean room, hair on the sheets, funky carpet, etc. The Bed: Worst of all. We were unable to sleep at all on what was easily the most uncomfortable mattress we've ever to encounter. Purse stone. I've seen hard mattresses before but this one will leave a mark on you. Spend the extra $20 for another hotel and bed you can actually sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Much much better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: Marketeer24
Reviews.Content: Upon first glance this motel looks like it has the potential to be a complete dive...on the very edge of what goes from a shabby neighborhood to a BAD neighborhood. Outside room doors, exterior doesn't look upscale in the least. But I think you might be surprised by this place. Lobby is very nice, clean, looks recently updated, with a few cute touches. Cute little breakfast nook (although I hate breakfast and didn't try it, it looked decent...cereal, juice, milk, and fruit at the least). Desk clerks weren't Ritz-Carlton caliber obviously :) but were nice and not rude. The rooms were SURPRISINGLY nice. Extremely large for the price (mine looked like a mini-suite!) with a small sofa, desk, large TV in an armoire, a large mini-fridge, microwave, iron and ironing board (hair dryer too I believe), and a king bed! I paid $69 but could have easily paid $55 through the BW site had I booked earlier. Interior looked brand new...nice wallpaper and borders, a cute floral arrangement on the armoire, all in all it felt very much steps above a standard room. Such a nice, big room. I have stayed in much worse rooms for twice that price. There is a roomy sink/dressing area (including a rather large closet with a door!) with granite sinktop. The bathroom looked a little shabby (in comparison) with some cracked tile, worn looking walls in the shower, old looking faucets, etc, but in comparison to the rest of the room it really didn't matter. Water pressure in the shower was fabulous...when I arrived LATE Friday night I took a very, very long shower and had hot water like crazy...however, come Sunday check out, very little was left. I suspect this is one of those motels that runs out of hot water early in the day. I waited fifteen minutes and got back in to tepid water..it never did get hot again, but it wasn't unbearable, either. I have generally bad luck with hot water in hotels though so it may just have been me! I don't want to take a "brief" shower unless I am running mortally late and resent it when hot water is just about zapped after ten minutes! Beds were okay...not incredibly comfortable but not the Conestoga-wagon style beds made out of concrete I stayed in the next night at a Country Hearth Inn! Pillows weren't exceptionally thick either but weren't the dreaded toilet-paper thin wafers that some places dish out. Nothing stood out as exceptionally uncomfortable. The truly exceptional thing I encountered here was the leniency with check out. I was allowed to check out at 1 pm without any hassles. We got another call at around 12:30 where we reconfirmed the night manager OK'ed it and that was that. When I have had so many hassles with rudeness and absolutely unbendable rules with check outs, this was truly a treat. Kudos to the staff for not being rude or inflexible about this. The room would have been very quiet and peaceful had it not been for the rude guests that showed up Friday night. An SUV stood parked outside the pool with one of the loudest car audio systems I've ever heard (in any other context, I'd be impressed!) and at 2 am had the bass cranked so loud that my own bed was vibrating slightly despite being on the other side of the hotel from it. It sounded like one of the upstairs rooms was having a big party since I heard some bass, people shouting/stomping around, and so on for a little while. I wasn't in a hurry to sleep but I don't know how it didn't wake up others around me...after a good half hour, it quit; not sure if it was the hotel staff that said something or they just stopped themselves. This isn't the hotel's fault- it's the fault of the rude guests. Otherwise the rooms seemed pretty soundtight..I wouldn't suggest staying near the ice machine though, because I heard that grinding away all day and night, LOL. I was a woman traveling alone for the first night so I was paying close attention to my safety. There were plenty of cameras and the parking lot was well-lit; I didn't feel like I was in the best of neighborhoods but I have been in much worse! Very very close to the airport and the venue I was in town for (Mid-South Coliseum). Downtown was another quick drive, and Graceland is literally one exit down. It seems like a good central location if you're renting a car and flying in and out. I found the Wolfchase Galleria about twenty minutes away with every retail store, Macy's-type, and food outlet you could possibly want. (This area seemed VERY nice...Germantown..seemed like a bit more upscale area to stay in if you are looking for that) All in all, a very nice experience. I have had so many more hassles and disappointments with hotels three times the price of this one. Such large rooms that definitely feel more expensive than they are. Highly suggested!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Executive Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. we had a great expericence back in 2000 during the opening of the hotel. we returned to memphis a few times after and always choose this hotel. large rooms and very clean!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Executive Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3105 Millbranch Road, Memphis, TN 38116-1917
